alert.note: Alert for Briscoe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 5:31PM CDT until August 29 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: .An area of thunderstorms, some of which have very high rainfall rates will produce localized flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, in northwest Texas, Floyd and Motley. In the Panhandle of Texas, Briscoe, Hall and Swisher. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over parts of the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Silverton, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Lockney, Quitaque, Vigo Park, South Plains, Valley Schools, Mackenzie Reservoir, Flomot and Aiken. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
